programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: The Mets' David Peterson seeks revenge against the Giants in a series finale. Peterson permitted seven runs in five innings of a 7-4 setback at San Francisco in April. Brandon Crawford (SF) belted a three-run homer in the first frame of that game.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Home Run Derby Bracket Show
programme.desc: Eight of baseball's best sluggers are paired up to compete in the upcoming Home Run Derby. The winners of each round will advance in the competition. From Dodger Stadium in Los Angeles.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Veteran broadcaster Michael Kay joins former slugger Alex Rodriguez to provide commentary on Sunday Night Baseball. Plus, discussion on fantasy baseball, predictive analytics and special guests tied to the game.

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: From Red Bull Ring in Austria.

programme.desc: Previews, highlights and stories involving events and athletes from the X Games.

programme.title: 2023 ESPY's Nomination Special
programme.desc: The athletes nominated for 2023 ESPY Awards are announced. The annual awards show honors the top athletes and teams, and the best performances in 22 categories, including Best Athlete (Men's and Women's), Best Breakthrough Athlete, and many more.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Southern California sides meet for the first time since 2021 as the Padres host the Angels. The teams split four meetings that year, giving Los Angeles a 21-18 all-time advantage. San Diego's Jake Cronenworth was 5-for-15 during that series.

programme.desc: Southern California sides meet for the first time since 2021 as the Padres host the Angels. The teams split four meetings that year, giving Los Angeles a 21-18 all-time advantage. San Diego's Jake Cronenworth was 5-for-15 during that series.

programme.desc: Ben Verlander sits down with international baseball phenom and Los Angeles Angels pitcher/designated hitter, Shohei Ohtani, for an exclusive all-access interview and in-depth conversation about Ohtani's unique path to superstardom.

programme.title: Dunk Contest
programme.desc: First-ever slam dunk contest was held in 1976, which was won by Julius Erving over David Thompson. In 1984, the contest was reintroduced with Larry Nance beating Julius Erving.

programme.title: Dunk Contest
programme.desc: Spud Webb and Dominique Wilkins compete in the finals of the 1986 Slam Dunk contest from Dallas.

programme.title: Dunk Contest
programme.desc: Isaiah Rider, Robert Pack and Shawn Kemp compete in the finals of the 1994 Slam Dunk contest from Minneapolis.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: Lakers G Kobe Bryant, Timberwolves G Chris Carr, and Mavericks G Michael Finley compete in the Finals of the 1997 NBA Slam Dunk Contest from Cleveland.

programme.title: Dunk Contest
programme.desc: Jason Richardson, Desmond Mason, Amar'e Stoudemire and Richard Jefferson compete in 2003 contest. From Atlanta.

programme.title: Dunk Contest
programme.desc: Dwight Howard, Gerald Green, Jamario Moon and Rudy Gay compete in the 2008 contest. First time winner was chosen by fan text messages. From New Orleans.

programme.title: Dunk Contest
programme.desc: Nate Robinson, Dwight Howard, J.R. Smith and Rudy Fernandez compete in the 2009 contest. Robinson won the contest dressed in all green as "Krypto-Nate" and jumped over Howard as Superman. From Phoenix.

programme.title: Dunk Contest
programme.desc: Blake Griffin, Javale McGee, DeMar DeRozan and Serge Ibaka compete in the 2011 contest. Griffin wins the fan vote after jumping over a car with a choir singing "I Believe I can Fly." From Los Angeles.

programme.title: Dunk Contest
programme.desc: Zach Lavine, Victor Oladipo, Mason Plumtree and Giannis Antetokounmpo compete in the 2015 contest. Lavine is the second youngest winner of the contest (Kobe Bryant is the youngest). From Brooklyn, N.Y.

programme.title: Dunk Contest
programme.desc: Featuring Derrick Jones Jr., Aaron Gordon, Dwight Howard, Pat Connaughton. From Feb. 16, 2020.

programme.title: Dunk Contest
programme.desc: Michael Jordan and Dominique Wilkins compete in the finals of the 1985 Slam Dunk contest from Indianapolis.

programme.title: Dunk Contest
programme.desc: Michael Jordan and Dominique Wilkins compete in the finals of the 1988 Slam Dunk contest from Chicago.

programme.title: Dunk Contest
programme.desc: Vince Carter, Steve Francis, Tracy McGrady, Ricky Davis, Jerry Stackhouse and Larry Hughes compete in the 2000 contest. From Oakland, Calif.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: With a dunk from just inside the free throw line, Zach LaVine earned his fifth score of 50 on the night, making him the 2016 NBA dunk champ. The 20-year-old LaVine became the first back-to-back winner since Nate Robinson in 2009 and 2010.
